pullRequest.title: JEP 360/JEP 384 Sealed classes and records DDR support
pullRequest.bodyText:
Fixes: #9626
Related: #9529
0.22 port: #10405 #10443
This ended up being support for both sealed classes and records which was missed in Java 14.

cfdump -x <classfile>
!dumpromclass <address>
!dumpromclasslinear <address>

Signed-off-by: Theresa Mammarella Theresa.T.Mammarella@ibm.com

beforeCommit.message:
JEP 360/JEP 384 Sealed classes and records ddr support

Signed-off-by: Theresa Mammarella <Theresa.T.Mammarella@ibm.com>

afterCommit.message:
JEP 360/JEP 384 Sealed classes and records ddr support

Signed-off-by: Theresa Mammarella <Theresa.T.Mammarella@ibm.com>

nodes.bodyText: Please keep imports sorted.
Please remove trailing whitespace (at least in new code).
Please leave a blank line between methods.
Have you verified that no tests are affected by this change?

Please instead use out.format("Permitted subclasses (%d):%n", permittedSubclassCount)

%n expresses the desired newline
there's no need to build the string locally
out.format("   %s%n", J9UTF8Helper.stringValue(permittedSubclassName));
Spaces after closing ) are missing.
formatting: please move brace to end of preceding line.

Please be consistent: * next to name instead of type:
J9UTF8 *permittedSubclassNameUtf8 = ...

getNumberOfPermittedSubclassesPtr seems a strange API to me: why return a pointer (nobody appears to write to it)?
If we decide to change it, that change should be deferred to a separate pull request.
formatting (here and line 1358)

Moving the constants below to a new namespace creates a discontinuity in core files.
The change seems reasonable, but I please confirm you did so consciously.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -108,6 +108,8 @@
 #define J9FieldTypeMask 0x380000
 #define J9FieldTypeShort 0x280000
 
+/* @ddr_namespace: map_to_type=J9RecordComponentFlags */

nodes.bodyText: Please remove all trailing whitespace in code you're adding (e.g. this line).
This comment is stale, and I'm not sure it added much value.
Please remove the trailing whitespace.
Suggest you say srpPtr.notNull(), or invert.
Suggest permittedSubclassPointer.notNull() or invert.
Suggest permittedSubclassPointer.notNull() or invert.
Most calls to addSlot() supply a slot name beginning with a lower-case letter: why the departure here and on line 700 below?
